name: seffa
ingredients: 400 g of fine or medium durum wheat semolina (couscous)
Sugar (a pinch for cooking, or more to taste)
For serving: Powdered sugar, Ground cinnamon, Almond flakes (optional), Dates, Milk or Mint tea (to accompany)
steps: Prepare the semolina for steaming (3 traditional steamings): Moisten the semolina, fluff it, and let it swell for 15 minutes. Place the semolina in the top of the steamer for the first steaming (15 minutes).
Fluff the semolina. Add the raisins and steam for an additional 15 minutes (second steaming).
Transfer the semolina to a bowl. Fluff it while incorporating the butter, salt, and sugar.
Steam a third time for 15 minutes (for perfect cooking, although the simplified recipe only mentions two steamings).
Shape the seffa into a dome on a large plate. Generously sprinkle with powdered sugar and cinnamon (creating stripes if desired).
Garnish with almond flakes and other decorations. Enjoy with a glass of milk or mint tea.
